metadata.name: Project
metadata.description:
Project

Project is a high-level Google Cloud Platform entity. It is a container for ACLs, APIs, AppEngine Apps, VMs, and other Google Cloud Platform resources.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.update do |p|
  p.name = "My Project"
  p.labels["env"] = "production"
end

metadata.name: project_id
metadata.description: The unique, user-assigned ID of the project. It must be 6 to 30 lowercase letters, digits, or hyphens. It must start with a letter. Trailing hyphens are prohibited. e.g. tokyo-rain-123

metadata.name: project_number
metadata.description: The number uniquely identifying the project. e.g. 415104041262

metadata.name: name
metadata.description: The user-assigned name of the project.

metadata.name: name=
metadata.description:
Updates the user-assigned name of the project. This field is optional and can remain unset.

Allowed characters are: lowercase and uppercase letters, numbers, hyphen, single-quote, double-quote, space, and exclamation point.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.name = "My Project"

metadata.name: labels
metadata.description:
The labels associated with this project.

Label keys must be between 1 and 63 characters long and must conform to the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?.

Label values must be between 0 and 63 characters long and must conform to the regular expression ([a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?)?.

No more than 256 labels can be associated with a given resource. (Hash)

examples.caption: Labels are read-only and cannot be changed:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.labels["env"] #=> "dev" # read only
project.labels["env"] = "production" # raises error

examples.caption: Labels can be updated by passing a block, or with #labels=:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.labels do |labels|
  labels["env"] = "production"
end

metadata.name: labels=
metadata.description:
Updates the labels associated with this project.

Label keys must be between 1 and 63 characters long and must conform to the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?.

Label values must be between 0 and 63 characters long and must conform to the regular expression ([a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?)?.

No more than 256 labels can be associated with a given resource. (Hash)

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.labels = { "env" => "production" }

metadata.name: created_at
metadata.description: The time that this project was created.

metadata.name: state
metadata.description:
The project lifecycle state.

Possible values are: * ACTIVE - The normal and active state. * LIFECYCLE_STATE_UNSPECIFIED - Unspecified state. This is only used/useful for distinguishing unset values. * DELETE_REQUESTED - The project has been marked for deletion by the user (by invoking DeleteProject) or by the system (Google Cloud Platform). This can generally be reversed by invoking UndeleteProject. * DELETE_IN_PROGRESS - The process of deleting the project has begun. Reversing the deletion is no longer possible.

metadata.name: active?
metadata.description: Checks if the state is ACTIVE.

metadata.name: unspecified?
metadata.description: Checks if the state is LIFECYCLE_STATE_UNSPECIFIED.

metadata.name: delete_requested?
metadata.description: Checks if the state is DELETE_REQUESTED.

metadata.name: delete_in_progress?
metadata.description: Checks if the state is DELETE_IN_PROGRESS.

metadata.name: update
metadata.description: Updates the project in a single API call. See Project::Updater

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.update do |p|
  p.name = "My Project"
  p.labels["env"] = "production"
end

params.name: yield
params.description: a block yielding a project delegate

params.name: yield.project
params.description: the delegate object for updating the project

metadata.name: reload!
metadata.description: Reloads the project (with updated state) from the Google Cloud Resource Manager service.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.reload!

metadata.name: delete
metadata.description:
Marks the project for deletion. This method will only affect the project if the following criteria are met:

  • The project does not have a billing account associated with it.
  • The project has a lifecycle state of ACTIVE.
  • This method changes the project’s lifecycle state from ACTIVE to DELETE_REQUESTED. The deletion starts at an unspecified time, at which point the lifecycle state changes to DELETE_IN_PROGRESS.

Until the deletion completes, you can check the lifecycle state by calling #reload!, or by retrieving the project with Manager#project. The project remains visible to Manager#project and Manager#projects, but cannot be updated.

After the deletion completes, the project is not retrievable by the Manager#project and Manager#projects methods.

The caller must have modify permissions for this project.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.active? #=> true
project.delete
project.active? #=> false
project.delete_requested? #=> true

metadata.name: undelete
metadata.description:
Restores the project. You can only use this method for a project that has a lifecycle state of DELETE_REQUESTED. After deletion starts, as indicated by a lifecycle state of DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, the project cannot be restored.

The caller must have modify permissions for this project.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
project.delete_requested? #=> true
project.undelete
project.delete_requested? #=> false
project.active? #=> true

metadata.name: policy
metadata.description:
Gets the Cloud IAM access control policy. Returns a hash that conforms to the following structure:

{ “bindings” => [{ “role” => “roles/viewer”, “members” => [“serviceAccount:your-service-account”] }], “version” => 0, “etag” => “CAE=” }

examples.caption: Policy values are memoized by default:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
policy = project.policy

puts policy["bindings"]
puts policy["version"]
puts policy["etag"]

examples.caption: Use the force option to retrieve the latest policy:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
policy = project.policy force: true

params.name: force
params.description: Force load the latest policy when true. Otherwise the policy will be memoized to reduce the number of API calls made. The default is false.

metadata.name: policy=
metadata.description: Sets the Cloud IAM access control policy.

params.name: new_policy
params.description:
A hash that conforms to the following structure:

{ “bindings” => [{ “role” => “roles/viewer”, “members” => [“serviceAccount:your-service-account”] }] }

metadata.name: test_permissions
metadata.description: Tests the specified permissions against the Cloud IAM access control policy.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
project = resource_manager.project "tokyo-rain-123"
perms = project.test_permissions "resourcemanager.projects.get",
                                 "resourcemanager.projects.delete"
perms.include? "resourcemanager.projects.get"    #=> true
perms.include? "resourcemanager.projects.delete" #=> false

params.name: *permissions
params.description: The set of permissions to check access for. Permissions with wildcards (such as * or storage.*) are not allowed.

metadata.name: ensure_connection!
metadata.description: Raise an error unless an active connection is available.
